text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
vaccinationCertificate 1..1vaccinationCertificateEU Vaccination Certificate
subject S1..1BackboneElementPerson identification
name S1..*HumanNamePerson name
identifier S0..*IdentifierPerson identifier
sex S0..1CodeableConceptSex
birthDate S0..1dateTimePerson date of birth
vaccination S1..*BackboneElementVaccination / prophylaxis information
targetDisease S0..*CodeableConceptDisease or agent targeted
vaccineCode S1..*CodeableConceptVaccine or prophylaxis
vaccineProductName S1..*stringVaccine medicinal product
vaccineMarketingAuthorizationHolder S1..1stringMarketing Authorization Holder
doseNumber S1..1BackboneElementNumber in a series of vaccinations / doses
vaccineBatchNumber S0..1stringBatch/lot number
dateOfVaccination S1..1dateTimeDate of vaccination
administeringCentre S1..1OrganizationAdministering centre
healthProfessionalIdentification S0..*PractitionerHealth Professional identification
countryOfVaccination S1..1CodeableConceptCountry of vaccination
dateNextDose S0..1dateTimeNext vaccination date
metaData S1..1BackboneElementCertificate metadata
issuer S1..1CodeableConceptCertificate Issuer
certificateId S1..1IdentifierCertificate identifier
startValidity S0..1dateTimeCertificate valid from
endValidity S0..1dateTimeCertificate valid until
certificateSchemaVersion S1..1IdentifierCertificate schema version

Documentation for this format

name: vaccinationCertificatemedicalUse
title: EU Digital Green Certificate - Medical Use
description: Logical Model representing the EU Digital Green Certificate for Medical Use

element.definition: EU Vaccination Certificate content

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
If no Person identifier is provided then the date of birth shall be valued

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Person identification
The legal name of the vaccinated person

An identifier of the vaccinated person, according to the policies applicable in each country. It should be captured what type of identifier is used. Examples: citizen ID card or identifier within the health system/IIS/e-registry.
Administrative gender
Vaccinated person’s date of birth. Mandatory if no Person identifier is provided.
Vaccination / prophylaxis information
Disease or agent that the vaccination provides protection against

Generic description of the vaccine/Vaccine component(s).
Example:
J07BX03 covid-19 vaccines (temporary code, to be implemented in ATC 2022)
1119349007 | COVID-19 mRNA vaccine |
1119305005 | COVID-19 antigen vaccine |

Medicinal product name
Example: 
COMIRNATY concentrate for dispersion for injection
Marketing Authorisation Holder

element.short: Number in a series of vaccinations / doses
element.definition: Order in the vaccination course
A distinctive combination of numbers and/or letters which specifically identifies a batch
Date of vaccination
Name/code of administering centre or a health authority responsible for the vaccination event
Name or health professional code responsible for administering the vaccine or prophylaxis
The country in which the individual has been vaccinated
Date on which the next vaccination should be administered
Certificate metadata
Entity that has issued the certificate (allowing to check the certificate)
Unique identifier of the certificate (UVCI), to be printed (human readable) into the certificate; the unique identifier can be included in the IIS
Certificate valid from (required if known)
Certificate valid until (validity can differ from the expected immunisation period)
Version of this minimum dataset definition - currently set at 1.0.0
